data.title: Dive into anything
data.text:
In Deluge Season 4 Ep. 23 there is a short Newsreel clip of someone named Joe E. Brown asking for blood donations. I always thought he looked like a comedian who was being very serious.

So who was Joe E Brown?

Joseph Evans Brown (July 28, 1891 â€“ July 6, 1973) was an American actor and comedian, remembered for his friendly screen persona, comic timing, and enormous elastic-mouth smile.[1] He was one of the most popular American comedians in the 1930s and 1940s, with films like A Midsummer Night's Dream (1935), Earthworm Tractors (1936), and Alibi Ike (1935). In his later career Brown starred in Some Like It Hot (1959), as Osgood Fielding III, in which he utters the film's famous punchline "Well, nobody's perfect."
